channel.title: Pickpocketing help - Scar script

item.title: Pickpocketing help - Scar script
item.dc:creator: @Innovation Innovation
item.description:
@Innovation wrote:

Well I thought this would work but apparently it’s not. I was trying to call 2 x,y axis locations in 1 time with mouse color but I think I’m doing something wrong.

Here’s what I got

[code]program Thiever;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}

const
delay = 300;
NPC = 4821407;///NPC color

var
x,y : integer;

procedure thieve;
begin
If(findcolor(x, y, NPC, 0, 0, 600, 600))then
Mouse(x,y,2,2,false);
wait(10);
Mouse(x,(y-40),true);
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
repeat
wait(delay+random(250));
thieve;
until(false)
end.[/code]

When I right click the “man” I was trying to get from that current location, -40 down the y axis of that current location to “pickpocket” which I thought would work.

It doesn’t work the mouse goes straight to x,y top right screen and 40 down lol.

So I tried another method of bitmaps. I selected the “pickpocket” text, and painted the background black and whatnot got it all setup, and after I added in a conditional statement to see if it’d say if it found that image or not, it never found it.

So I read the help file in F1 and found another method of text searching, well I couldn’t figure out how to get that to work to just search for the text “pickpocket.” And yeah.

Anyone have any solution to this? I wanna be able to click pickpocket. >.<

Read full topic
